title: Cloud Study
content:
I really like the Cloud Study series by British landscape painter John Constable, and I found that the clouds that I used to take for granted have so many variations in light, shadow, color and structure. So I decided to record these clouds in my own way with a series also called cloud study. Sunshine, sunset, architecture, and weather really paint colorful colors on these pure white clouds. I will keep updating this collection. ---

title: Film Photography x B&W
content:
This group of photos were shot with the black & white film, ILFORD DELTA 400, at the downtown of Wuhan. The grainly texture of the original photos was so intriguing. However, the pictures displayed here has been signifcantly compressed due to the large size of the original photos. ---

title: Film Photography x WUHAN
content:
I started using NOMO a year ago, a very popular analog film photography application; I am deeply touched by the diversity/fineness/color/light/UI design of the film simulation by the developer([@flypig](https://www.youtube.com/user/flypigdotorg)). While being impressed by the color and light of the film, I planed to find a film camera to truly experience the feeling of film photography. Surprisingly, a film point-and-shoot camera from nearly 20 years ago, [Canon Prima Zoom 76](https://global.canon/en/c-museum/product/film220.html), was found in the bookcase at my home. The camera is fully-functional, so I bought a film right away and took a day to walk among the streets of Wuhan to take this group of experimental photos. And I was so satisfied by the quality of these photos! For the first time, I truly experienced the joy and beauty of film photography and regained some pleasure of "analog signal" in such an digital era. ---

title: T-minus 0
content:
+ <!-- more --> ...T-minus 3, 2, 1. Ignition and lift-off!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
---

This is the very first post of my blog. Though it's not a big project, I hope to keep a record of my daily-life discorveries, interesting ideas, art works, and progress towards my academic goals. Cheers!
